title: Another foreign loan project gathering dust in SL
byline: The Oluvil Port, another loan project implemented in the Eastern Province of Sri Lanka, has now turned out to be another white elephant remaining idle for a dozen years, and the current government is now at a loss to determine ways to make it economically viable somehow, the Daily Mirror learns.

title: Code of Criminal Procedure Amendment in accordance with Constitution: SC informs Speaker
byline: The Supreme Court has held that the Code of Criminal Procedure Bill is accordance with the Constitution, Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne informed Parliament today.

title: Sri Lanka battles gun violence, road accidents, drug trafficking
byline: Sri Lanka is witnessing a troubling spike in both gun violence and road fatalities, with over 1,000 deaths on the roads and dozens killed in 46 shooting incidents so far this year.

title: Cabinet approves relief for low-income depositors affected by withholding tax
byline: The Cabinet has approved a proposal to provide relief to low-income individuals affected by the recent increase in the withholding tax rate from 5% to 10%, introduced under the Inland Revenue (Amendment) Act No. 2 of 2025, effective from April 1, 2025.

title: Bribery Commission files case against former Minister Chandrani Bandara
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has filed an indictment against former Minister Chandrani Bandara before the Colombo High Court over alleged irregular appointments made in 2019.

title: Mumbai Indians signs Charith Asalanka
byline: Mumbai Indians (MI) have signed three overseas replacement players, including Charith Asalanka, for the ongoing 2025 season, it was confirmed by the Indian Premier League (IPL) on Tuesday. The Hardik pandya-led MI have signed Jonny Bairstow, Richard Gleeson and Charith Asalanka as replacements for Will Jacks, Ryan Rickelton and Corbin Bosch.

title: Police identify 52 areas with highest crime rate: Public Security Minister
byline: The Sri Lanka Police have identified 52 police areas countrywide with the highest crime rate, Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said in Parliament today.

title: Keheliya further remanded: His son named suspect in Rs. 8M misuse case
byline: Former Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella’s son Ramith Rambukwella has been named as a suspect in the allegations of misappropriating approximately Rs. 8 million from Ministry funds to pay salaries and maintain staff, despite these individuals not rendering any official services.

title: Young British woman held on drug charges in Sri Lanka could be linked to Culley case
byline: Within a day of Bella May Culley being arrested at a Georgian airport for allegedly trying to smuggle 14kg of cannabis, the same fate met another Briton 3,000 miles away.

title: Train services restored after elephant collision on Batticaloa line
byline: Train services on the Batticaloa line were temporarily disrupted last night after a wild elephant was fatally struck by a passenger train travelling from Colombo to Batticaloa.

title: Harini receives death threats via email: Minister
byline: An investigation has already begun over a death threat on Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya via gmail, Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala told Parliament today.

title: Intelligence services reveal SLPP, UNP, SJB politicians maintain direct links with underworld: Minister
byline: Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala said intelligence services have uncovered direct political links with underworld activities and the names of such politicians will be presented in Parliament after police investigations.

title: School bus driver arrested for drunk driving with children onboard
byline: The Katupotha Police arrested the driver of a ‘Sisuseriya’ school bus for driving under the influence of alcohol while transporting a group of children.

title: New Zealand Deputy Prime Minister to visit Sri Lanka
byline: The Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Foreign Affairs of New Zealand, Winston Peters, will undertake an official visit to Sri Lanka from May 24 to 28.

title: National security not lost yet, but possible: MR
byline: It is not yet possible to say that the country’s national security will be lost, but it could happen, former President Mahinda Rajapaksa said at the War Heroes’ Memorial in Battaramulla today.

title: Harak Kata brought to court under tight security after bribery claims
byline: Just days after making serious allegations to the media, notorious underworld figure Nadun Chinthaka Wickremeratne, alias ’Harak Kata’, was produced before court today under tight security, with officers shielding him from the media during his arrival.

title: Ven. Sumanarathana Thera suspended from his position as Chief Sanghanayake
byline: Ven. Katumuluwe Sumanarathana Thera of the Padeniya Rajamaha Vihara has been suspended from his position as Chief Sanghanayake of the Devamedi Hatpatuwa by the Malwatta Chapter for holding the ’Sihinaya’ programme on May 17 at the Padeniya Rajamaha Vihara.

title: Applications open for 2025 A/L Vocational Stream admissions regardless of O/L results
byline: The Education Ministry announced that applications are now being accepted for admission to Grade 12 under the Advanced Level (A/L) Vocational stream for the academic year 2025.

title: Three Sri Lankan women from Thailand nabbed with Rs.120 Mn worth Kush at BIA
byline: Three local females attempting to smuggle in Rs. 120 million worth of Kush concealed in electrical appliances from Thailand were arrested by the Sri Lanka Customs at the Bandaranaike International Airport today.

title: World Test Championship Final: All You Need to Know
byline: The Ultimate Test nears closer as the two best teams, South Africa and Australia, do battle for the World Test Championship mace from 11 June.

title: NPP confident Vraie Balthazaar will be sworn in as CMC Mayor
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) today expressed confidence that it will form an administration in the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) where Vraie Cally Balthazaar will be sworn in as the new Mayor, Deputy Minister Sunil Watagala told Parliament today.

title: Wildlife Dept. gets 3,500 permanent Multi-tasking Officers to maintain electric fences
byline: The Public Service Commission has approved the permanent appointment of 3,500 Multi-tasking Officers attached to the Wildlife Department to maintain electric fences, Environment Minister Dr. Dammika Patabendi said.

title: Gold-coloured firearm found in Colombo apartment complex
byline: A suspected T56 assault rifle was recovered from a luxury apartment at the Havelock City housing complex in Colombo following a tip-off from a security officer, police said.

title: President demoted war heroes to ordinary soldiers: Namal
byline: While difficultly paying tribute to the war heroes, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake reduced the war heroes to ordinary soldiers, Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said.

title: CSE ends lower as investor activity slows ASPI and S&P SL20 decline
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed on a negative note, reversing its recent upward momentum. The downturn was attributed to low investor activity during the day.

title: US Embassy warns public of fake social media accounts posing as officials
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Sri Lanka has issued a warning to the public about a recent surge in fake social media accounts impersonating embassy officials.

title: Presidential Secretariat donates five vehicles to support disabled war veterans
byline: The Presidential Secretariat has donated five vehicles today to support the rehabilitation of disabled war veterans, where the ceremonial handing over took place at the secretariat vehicle yard.

title: A Million rupees spent looking for ’Sumedha’, but yet to be found
byline: Over Rs. 1 million has been spent on the ongoing operation to locate ‘Sumedha’, the elephant that went missing after an accident in Galapitagala, Maradankadawala in Habarana on March 7. The accident occurred when the elephant collided with a lorry.

title: Labour Department suspends services for 3 days due to network maintenance
byline: The Labour Department announced that several of its services, including the payment of funds to its members, will be temporarily suspended for three days starting tomorrow (21).

title: Prison officers, driver suspended for allowing inmate’s family on prison bus
byline: Two prison officers and a prison bus driver attached to the Angunakolapelessa Prison have been suspended over an incident where an inmate and his family members were found travelling in a prison bus parked outside Weligama town, Prison Media Spokesperson Gamini B. Dissanayake said.

title: Directive from President to renovate canals, drainage system in Colombo
byline: In response to the rapid rise in dengue and chikungunya cases in the Colombo District, President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed the relevant officials to promptly address the urgent repairs needed for the canals and drainage system.

title: President appoints committee to probe corruption at SriLankan Airlines
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has ordered the formation of a special committee to investigate allegations of corruption and irregularities at SriLankan Airlines.
